Intervention: Effect of bright light on fatigue in women with breast cancer
Effect of red light on fatigue in women with breast cancer
Eligibility: · Chemotherapy with adjuvant or neoadjuvant anthracycline
- Metastatic or inoperative breast cancer (including inflammatory)
The confusion of underlying medical diseases
History of other I-axis psychiatric disorders
Results: The short form of the multidimensional fatigue symptom inventory (MFSI-sf) was used to measure fatigue. The range of possible scores for each subscale is 0-24, and the total score range is -24-96, with a higher score indicating more severe fatigue, except for the Vigor subscale, where the higher score indicates less fatigue.
Time frame: four cycles of chemotherapy
Title of arm/group: Effect of bright light
Description of the arm/group: Effect of bright light on fatigue in women with breast cancer
Unit of measurement: units on a scale 15.25 (5.5)
Title of arm/group: Effect of red light
Description of the arm/group: effect of red light on fatigue in women with breast cancer
Unit of measurement: units on a scale 21.6 (7.2)
